intro: Justicia divergens, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Justicia divergens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
